title: Comparison of function and its derivative values

content.question: The graph of the differentiable function <math> <mi>f</mi> </math> is shown in the figure above. Let <math> <mi>h</mi> </math> be the function defined by <math> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow> </math>. Which of the following correctly orders <math> <mrow> <mi>h</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math>, <math> <mrow> <msup> <mi>h</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math>, and <math> <mrow> <msup> <mi>h</mi> <mo>″</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> ?

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
